column4:
It would be 5 stars... but after about 6 months the lens cover started sticking and wouldn't fully open or fully close.  I sent it back to Canon and they replaced under warranty with a refurbished camera.  Good customer service, it took about a week to get it replaced.  The replacement worked great for about 8 months, then it happened again, sticking lens cover. I sent it back to Canon hoping they might replace it again even though it was a couple of months out of warranty.  No luck, they will charge $147 to repair it.  I can replace it for not much more than that.  But since it lasts for only 6 to 8 months, it's time to search for a more reliable camera.  Bummer, it was great while it lasted."
20120611"
column7:
I purchased this after doing a lot of research and even returning the Elph 310. I decided that the 'upgrades' from the 300 to 310 weren't worth anything. Also, the 300 has a wider angle lens, which is more desirable. This is so small I take it every where with me, and can always snap a shot of my little one. It is even comfortable to hold, but I do have small hands. It takes great shots for a point and shoot. The only thing to know is that it does have its limitations. In low light(like inside a house) sometimes I have to stabilize it well or else I get blurry pics of my toddler. But the camera does warn you if that is going to happen. Still, the convenience of having it when I want it outweighs any negatives. The five stars is for this price range. Obviously a digital SLR will take much better pictures."
20120610"
column10:
Bought at the time it was just coming out, and thinking I was upgrading from my Sony w290, and going to Canon, I had very high expectations. I remember the 'wow' factor was not there at first use.Now, over a year has passed and feel its a good camera. The performance in low light is very good and by far the best improvement I had over my last camera. But I see colors are a little more dull on this camera's photos than the ones my Sony produced (in daylight).The HD video looks great and you have the ability to zoom in/out. Overall this is a great camera and for the price now is a great choice."
20120609"
column13:
I bought this camera as a replacement for a SD600 6 megapixel canon elph that was 6 years old.  Taking photos outdoors and in good natural light were comparable to the old camera.  photos taken indoors when the sun was beaming through the windows were yellow in color and not nearly as vibrant as the old camera.  I tried experimenting with the settings for a little while then gave up because the 'automatic' setting should work without having to read the manual (just like the old camera).  In my opinion canon missed the mark with this camera.  I've already returned it."
20120608"
column16:
Fits anywhere and I am amazed at the functionality. I was a little confused when the zoom went up to 24 power as I thought the camera was only a 5x. Zoom up to 5x is optical, then digital beyond that."
20120607"
column19:
This is the best camera I have ever owned - being an average photographer. It is easy to use, I can upload pictures from the camera to my computer with ease; it takes sharp, clean pictures, and is excellent for carrying in my small purse! The only issue would be re-charging the batteries - seems to charge down in a shorter time than I would prefer. I have only had the camera for approx 2 months and have already charged it twice and I don't use it everyday. Other than that, it is GREAT, I highly recommend."
20120606"
column22:
My wife and I bought this camera for our trip to Italy and we couldn't have been happier.  The pictures were crisp and clear, the battery life was great, and it fit nicely into her purse or my pocket.  If you're looking for a good, sturdy camera you've come to the right place!"
20120604"
column25:
My new Canon Powershot ELPH 300HS camera had all the characteristics I wanted in a small pocket camera, but it only lasted 13 months (just past the 1-year warranty) before a dark smudge appeared on every image, always in the same spot.Cleaning the lens didnt help, but web research revealed this as a common problem. It is caused by dust leaking through the zoom lens joints and finding it's way onto the CCD image sensor. There is no way to fix it yourself. You could send it to a repair center but you cant get a fixed estimate of cost and must pay $100 up front.  Canon wont address this product design flaw after the 12 month warranty. Yuk.!3 months is too short a life. I wont buy a Canon product again. My previous Canon developed a lazy lens flap which didnt always open completely, ruining numerous shots. Same response from Canon on that common problem as well: it's not our problem."
20120604"
column27: great little camera - but cheaper elsewhere
column28:
A compact camera that does a great job, with a 5X zoom lens, which is fairly fast at it's wide end (f/2.7) a great wide angle for indoor shots and very good low light performance. The only thing I did not like is the sometimes choppy zoom control. I really liked the metal body with a rough finish that allows us to maintain a good grip on the camera. Another plus is the dedicated video record button and e zoom automatically skews down when you go to video mode.One thing to note is that this is priced $30 less at my local big box store. Even with sales tax it beat the $167 price on Amazon - and I am a Prime customer who buys lots of things from them."
20120603"
column31:
My ex got the Lumix LZ3 in the divorce. It was a nice camera, but rather bulky for many occasions. I'd long wanted a super compact and this seemed to fit the bill, especially when it was on major sale at another establishment. Due to the price I paid, I almost gave this three stars, but found I couldn't recommend it at any price.On the plus side, the camera is very compact, very well built and has a very nice wide angle lens. I haven't used the HD video often, but it is much better than my old Lumix, though still has problems (see below). I actually like the simplicity of the settings, though the inability to easily override the basic settings has occasionally been a problem.On the negative side; the white balance is horrid. It will change even between consecutive pictures, especially in bright sunlight or low light. This happens with the HD video as well. It is quite annoying to be shooting a video of my granddaughter, shift the camera slightly and have the picture go yellow.(By comparison the Lumix was grainy and had poor color in low light, but in medium light and bright sunlight, the color was dead on. I miss that, especially at pools, the beach or the like.)The delay between pictures is excruciating at times. Sometimes it simply won't take a picture. I press the button, nothing happens, press it again, nothing happens, moment passes. Finally I can take a picture. Granted, this is common with digital cameras, but with Elph 300 HS seems worse than any I've used in this regard.The auto-focus is just plain weird. It's supposed to identify faces and focus on them. That works maybe half the time; the other half, it focuses on the most random things. On the other hand, you can force the focus point and it will track it correctly.I'm neutral on the flash. I've actually found it to be better than many other digital cameras I've used and I have fewer red-eye problems than with my Lumix (which also tended to overexpose a lot more.)In the end, this is definitely better than a lot of cameras out there, but I simply can't recommend it even if it's on sale. This purchase has really jaded me about Canon."
20120313"
column34:
It is Perfect small and thin camera , with perfect priceTake good pics and nice vediosBut screen is too small"
20120312"
column37:
I've owned many Canon cameras and liked them all.  This one is no exception.  I have not used it much yet but so far it is very easy to use, takes great photos and seems very sturdy."
20120312"
column39: A great PnS at this price level.
column40:
Disclaimer:  When it comes to photography, I'm little more than a somewhat advanced novice who knows some words like 'aperture' without fully understanding how it works.  Just a regular guy who likes to play at taking pictures.This camera is simple to use and produces good images decently quickly.  Personally, I don't see much of a difference between the quality level of the major manufacturers at this price point, so I say it's a good idea to head to some place where you can put your hands on each model, see which one feels right to you, and has a user interface you prefer.The form factor is great.  It's no big deal to keep this camera on you all the time, slides in and out of pockets fairly easily since the only real protrusion is the zoom toggle, which also acts as a bezel for the shutter button, and it is nicely rounded so it does not catch easily.  The available buttons are easy to find by feel, with a small exception being the the Func. Set button, but that generally happens when you put a button in the middle of a circular pad.The interface is greatly simplified.  For the most part, you're trusting Canon's engineers to figure out and apply the proper variables to your pictures.  This is even true of the Program mode where you have more control, but many features for more fine control are locked away from the user.  For example, there are over a dozen different modes (such as 'landscape', 'fireworks', 'portrait', etc.)  installed on this camera, and  you can only manually select a fraction of them.  Generally, this is no problem as the automated systems do a good job of selecting the proper settings, but generally does not equal always.For those of you who want more control, there is a firmware extension you can get called 'CHDK' that will give you much more detailed control and does work on the Elph300HS.The video function, I can't really speak on because aside from one test video, I haven't bothered with it.  Obviously, I think it bears pointing out that if you plan on taking a decent amount of video at full 1080p, you need as large and as fast of a memory card as you can afford.  1080p video is *huge*.I'm perfectly happy with the image quality so far.  Most all of my bad pictures have been because I was playing with CHDK and did something wrong myself.  I've taken around 1,000 shots so far with this camera and have yet to come across anything that even gets me slightly annoyed at it.  It's not perfect, but no piece of technology is.  It gives good image quality, but not great image quality; however, that's a function of giving less than $200 for a camera.  For what this camera is, at the price it is, I'm satisfied.All of that said, to address some of the points frequently brought up about this camera:Textured casing--personally, I like it.  People refer to it as a sandpaper like consistency, which I guess is true if you're talking about an extremely fine grit sandpaper.Camera Breaking--I'll update my review if this happens and change the score accordingly. From reading on the internet, the issues with it physically breaking seem to happen much more with the Chinese made models than the Japanese ones.  I have a Japanese one, for whatever that's worth."
20120312"
column43:
I mostly use this to document my work so I'm not taking many shots of people. I've found the flash to overpowering, it tends to whitewash the pictures so I've turned it off.You'll need to get a memory card as it doesn't come with one and a decent case to keep the lens from collecting dust and scratching the back screen."
20120311"
column46:
This Canon PowerShot ELPH 300HS Digital Camera is great!  The lightweight camera does all the functions and more that my family needs.  Very pleased!"
20120311"
column48: Thought this was a great camera...
column49:
Gave my wife this as a Christmas gift.  She used it once, before putting it into a case.  While it was in the case, it got dented.  The lens cover that automatically closes to protect the lens would not close.  The pictures taken with the camera were great, and it was easy to use, unfortunately the camera is not sturdy enough to withstand normal use.  In fact, it isn't even stout enough to withstand gentle use.Add in the fact that for some reason this camera now costs $80 more than it did in December, and I can't recommend this camera at all.  (Our last 3 cameras have been Canon Digital ELPH's and I've loved every one, until this model.)"
20120311"
column52:
Features wise - this is a very nice camera but when you touch the camera - its not that good. Actually the problem comes up when you try to use it. Though people say that rough texture is good as camera will not slip out of your hand but the feel of touching this camera is not good. So I didn't like it. I returned this camera and purchased a new one Canon ELPH 310 HS. Everything else is same in 310 as well. Outer texture is also good there. Also - 310 HS has 8X optical zoom. so overall - i liked 310 HS rather than 300 HS."
20120311"
column55:
I think this camera is the best I have had thus far.  I have purchased several Canon cameras before this last one and have enjoyed using them.  The Cannon Power shot that I purchased recently is quite easy to use, slim type makes it convenient to carry and it does take great pictures."
20120311"
column57: Very good but with some issues
column58:
The camera feels equal in construction to my last Canon Powershot, with an aluminum (to all appearances) body with plastic buttons and a big, nice screen. Yes, the bottom flap (over the battery casing) feels a bit cheap, but not when it's closed, only when it's open, and that's hardly ever.My main concern/issue with the camera isn't its construction, but rather in its photos. In indoor lighting conditions, especially the type of overhead poor lighting you see in offices and schools, it takes poor photos of people. How so? Well, on automatic, the color balance tends to make it appear as if everybody is wearing cake makeup. I also find the auto-white balance, when inside, to be rather too warm. In addition, on occasion the noise levels seem outrageously high (to be fair, I've also noticed the reverse, so that might just be on me.) You can overcome it by fiddling around on manual, but I just want to take decent photos of my classmates as soon as I turn my camera on. I also noticed it has a tendency to lack focus. So if you're lazy and take a lot of this type of photo, I'm not sure I'd recommend the camera. It does wonderfully in better lighting by windows and outside.The second issue I have with the photos it takes is the amount of fringing, which is more than I've ever experienced before. Granted, I've only shot with SLRs and my last two point-and-shoots, but it is significant and annoying. Still, it's hardly crippling.Otherwise, I found the camera to take very pleasing photos in decent lighting, retain very high amounts of detail in it's crisp macro shots, and be an improvement over my last Canon point-and-shoot. The images it makes are large and detailed, it does a good job of identifying faces (though it will see them where they don't exist, it finds them 90+% of the time when they are in the photo). Granted, I'm not sure how useful that is. It's good at preserving non-skintone colors, and I found that I can crop the images it takes about 50% and still have a usable photo. I never need the digital zoom, but I have played with it, and it's better than Canon's digital zoom used to be.The menus are not difficult to use, but their layout is inefficient, especially in manual mode. If you're buying a point-and-shoot to use in manual, (1) you have some introspection to do, and (2) this isn't your camera.I found it needs some urging to focus on the correct area of the photo, but what point-and-shoot doesn't? I also noticed distinctly lesser ISO noise in low lighting than in previous cameras I've owned, though more than you'd see in an SLR (of course).Overall, I'm happy I got the camera. It's inexpensive for the quality it delivers. It's lightweight, responsive and where lighting is passable, retains colors very well. It's not perfect, and its photos will never knock me off my feet, but I would have been foolish to expect a camera in this price range to be stunning. It's very good."
20120311"
column61:
This is a fabulous camera...it is the second Canon digital camera purchased over the past couple years.  The number of features will astound you and the price was terrific!"
20120311"
column64:
The looks are little unconventional ... It has a matte finish compared to the glossy ones we're used to! The other thing that catches the attention is the small size of it. It is very thin and makes you think never ever drop this one! Some reviews mentions that on dropping, the lens gets stuck. But I've dropped this a couple of times already (once on a hard surface from about 5 ft) but the camera just works fine...Coming to picture quality... I took more videos than photos on this one and the video quality was great when viewed on a HDTV. It was obviously not good when zoomed or under low light. I liked the photo quality as well, especially when taken in low light. Once, we couldn't use the flash as it was misty and the flash was reflecting on the water droplets. So I just switched the flash off and the photos came out really well. My friend was using a slightly older model of a canon camera and the pics were pathetic.This is  worth the money spent and amazon sweetened it with a free 4 gb sd card and a hdmi connector!"
20120311"
column67:
Main reason for buying the camera is because of the wide-angle lense.  Its small size is a plus, and it meets all my expectations."
20120311"
column70:
Great pics- quick, clear shots that enlarge well!  Small, but easy to use.  Had to get used to the smaller size when using the auto flash- fingers can easily cover it!  Just takes getting used to.  Excellent camera, great value!!!!"
20120311"
column73:
I love this little camera. It is tiny, lightweight. The pictures are great because I use the focus tracking almost all of the time. I want to make sure the focus is landing where I want it to.  Before I learned that I had a few slightly out of focus pictures."
20120311"
column76:
Love the camera and for the price I would buy again. Easy to use for the average photo person. Have not used the video yet but pictures are great. Took it on a rough sea day trip in Hi. whale watching and even with all the salt spray it was harder to keep my sunglasses clean than the camera."
20120310"
column79:
I just got this camera yesterday and the first few pictures I took didn't turn out very well, one of them is an outside shot of the trail we walk every day and the bottom half of the picture is brown.  A couple other pictures are super tiny and the camera said unidentified object.  Some have shadows on the bottom half of the picture has anyone else had this problem?"
20120309"
column82:
Me and my friend's were in a hurry to buy a digital camera as my old one gave way and we were headed for a trekking adventure. I do not want to miss out on the outdoor shots.I did not do any research, , just zeroed on Canon Powershot ELPH 300 HS 12.1 MP camera just for the confidence I had in Canon. The Canon ELPH 300 HS came with 5x optical zoom lens that offers optical image stabilization technology which mean I need not worry about shaken images. I was able to shoot in HD quality 1080p.The response time was faster and I realized that it was because of Canon's DIGIC 4 processor. Reviewing shots was simple and it is coming for sure for our next trip."
20120307"
column85:
Personnally I like this camera - it is small & takes great photos. The only problem is we had to return the first one we ordered because it died within two months of ordering it. Amazon was great though and swapped it for another one, no questions asked. We are keeping our fingers crossed that the new one will keep working."
20120307"
column88:
I admit I have limited experience with these small cameras. It's a great size, easy to hold and shoot with, so no complaints there. I just wish it had a higher zoom. The picture quality is definitely better than what appears on the the digital screen so withhold judgement on that until you bring them up on your computer or have them printed. Overall happy, just not ecstatic."
20120306"
column91:
Haven't even charged the battery yet, but I was very pleased by features so far.  First of all, love how tiny the camera is, second, very easy to register.  Didn't have to search for numbers as the card had them printed out (I registered online), third the instruction manual (very thin and easy) was separated from other languages.  These things make a huge difference to me.  Seems user friendly so far.  Will update if I find out otherwise."
20120305"
column93: Not so much a point and shoot
column94:
OK I know everyone has their own opinion but i will give you mine anyways. This is a great little camera to use everywhere. I have tried the auto setting and did not care for it so I use the program setting most of the time. I set the colors the way I like it along with the sharpness and contrast. I also change the ISO when needed(sometimes the camera chooses ISO higher than I would like) and have tried all the other settings with wonderful success. I just came back from Mexico and all my pictures were very good.Sometimes the picture The picture come out great if you use the camera correctly and know how to use the settings.The battery life is pretty good with almost lasting a full day of shooting and with changing a few things within the camera, it is also quick to take a picture. Overall this has been a kick-*** camera. Oh and the video is great also. So far no lens error but I also baby it. I purchased the canon case and it has been the perfect match. Having it on my belt and it being so small you along everyone else does'nt even know it is there. For the price unbelievable. Good luck and so far so good!!!"
20120305"
column97:
Just an FYI, but if you act quickly Walmart is selling these cameras on a 'rollback' promotion for $139.00. You have to actually call the store for availible stock, but I was able to get 3 yesterday,3-4-2012. Worth checking out if you're still in the market. I purchased it because I found that I was being lazy about carrying my Nikon DSLR. Now only if I would ever transfer the pics from my SD card, I've got a year worth of photos and vids on 5 various cards. Just pitiful!!!"
20120305"
column100:
Great compact camera for close up pictures. I'm a real estate broker and bought it for getting large views of interior house pictures in tight areas and it does fine.This is a wide angle camera built for capturing alot of the scene from close up. I wouldn't buy this camera if you are looking for something that zooms out to bring things close in for the picture because it does zoom out very far. Best for taking pictures of friends & family, to display your work, or for showing something to sell or show others- this is the better use for this camera.The video works real good but i had to set it down to 720 to stream it on my computer- the picture and sound was still very good at 720. My computer is older so maybe a newer one would stream higher def? You can always play back high def using the camera and displaying it on your computer/tv screen if you want higher def; but I prefer to download the camera and keep the memory cleaned out."
20120303"
column103:
I'm not a professional phtogtapher.  I just need a camera that can take good pictures, quickly and with little effort.  This one does.  The battery life had been good so far, too."
20120303"
column106:
I have to say I was very excited when I read reviews on the Canon ELPH 300 so I decided to replace my Canon SD1000 with the ELPH 300.  After using the ELPH 300 I have to say that I am VERY VERY VERY DISAPPOINTED!  The camera is AWFUL when it comes to action shots = everything is out of focus.  I can't depend on the ELPH 300 to give me GOOD PICTURES.  I am mad at myself for not returning it to Amazon for a refund......shame on me for waiting to return it.  I plan on going back to using my 'dependable' Canon SD1000. AMAZON 'IF' you read this review - feel free to contact me...........would love my $$$$ back"
20120302"
column109:
We had an older digital camera that was just not keeping up with our baby. By the time it focused, the moment was over. And that's not even talking about flash photos. Indoor shots were a mess, grainy or blurry. I did some serious research and we bought this camera. WOW! What an improvement. I'm yet to take it out of AUTO mode and we've got a lot of great photos already. I'm not a huge photography buff, I just wanted a point and shoot camera that performed well indoors. Well, I got that and more. I can take better photos indoors without flash with this camera than the old one took with flash. The time it takes to focus and take a shot is very fast - fast enough to catch a super active baby before he moves on. And the color balance is pretty darn tooting good to boot. Yes, it takes a few days to figure out how to get it to focus on the right thing so you have a few blurry pics at first. Yes, you can sometimes hear a little vrrrrrr sound when you are zooming out in the movie mode (never yet zooming in, hmmm). But I didn't get the camera to take movies (though I've ended up taking a bunch and the quality is better than from our Flip video camera) and the still photos are great. Battery lasted about a week of daily intermittent use. One feature I love - you don't have to turn the camera on (get the lens to come out) in order to review your photos, so it protects the sensitive lens from grubby little hands."
20120302"
column112:
My wife wanted a small, good-quality digital camera, so I did some research and bought the silver Canon 300 HS. My wife tends to put aesthetics before technical features and she didn't like the look of the camera. I have to admit, the black plastic buttons did look quite cheap-and-nasty.Also, she wanted a panoramic mode like my more expensive Sony camera. Although the description does say that there's a panoramic mode, it just means that the camera will help you take consecutive pictures that can later be combined into a panoramic mode using some PC software. The camera itself doesn't create a panoramic picture (unlike my Sony).In the end we swapped the Canon for a similar-priced Sony camera (DSC-W570) which looked much nicer and had a panoramic mode. This camera seemed to be simpler to operate too, compared to the Canon.In summary, we didn't actually use the Canon camera so I can't comment on the quality of the pictures, but this review is just to highlight a couple of things that I didn't see in other Amazon reviews."
20120302"
column114: Great camera for the normal individual
column115:
When I began my search for a digital camera I wanted something that could fit in my pocket and take great video. This camera is ultra compact and stylish. The 1080p video is fantastic and great for those who want to take videos good videos and not have to lug around a video camera. The pictures are very good and would probably surprise you. Good camera for those of us who aren't obsessive over the minute details but still want high quality."
20120229"
column118:
I love Canon cameras because they have the best lens of all of them. That is very important when factoring in the details. This camera is light weight and has some great features. I upgraded from my old cannon powershot which happened to last me 7 years! I am a loyal customer to Canon as they are the industry leaders in performance and reliability."
20120229"
column121:
This camera takes very good pictures.You will need to read the directions as its use is not very intuitive in its operation.The only fault I have is it did not come with the memory card."
20120227"
column124:
Like all the ELPH products, this one does not disappoint.  The sachet of the Canon makes it more expensive than other brands.  What you get is a good solid all around camera in the middle of the pack.  This unit does not have the widest FOV or the highest zoom; but for its size, it packs a lot of features."
20120226"
column127:
I currently own a Canon DSL and an older model Canon Power Shot Elph so chosing to buy this 300HS was a no brainer.  Amazon had the best price and it arrived no problem.  Unfortunately the Macro (or back) button doesn't work right.  When you push it, it performs the same function as the Movie start button and starts recording video.  Bizzare defect.  I reset the camera to factory defaults and tried everything else I could think of.  I've checked all of the forums looking for this problem and called Canon thinking maybe I needed a firmware update.  No firmware updates have been released yet and no mention of this defect on any forums.  Looks like I got just an old fashioned defect.  First problem I've ever had with any of my Canon cameras (even going back to my old film cameras).  I need to confirm with Canon tech support (they are only available M-F) but it looks like it's going back.Update (2/28/12):  Canon Tech support had never heard of this problem.  While they would repair it under warrenty, they suggested I return it to Amazon which would actuqally be easier.  At this point I still want this model camera because the combination of features, image quality and size can't be beat for the price.  The image quality and shooting options are outstanding but the defect makes it too difficult to use."
20120226"
column129: Canon ELPH 300 HS. Absolute stunner of a camera.
column130:
I have no idea when it comes to cameras! All I wanted was one I could stick in my pocket and quickly snap away when needed. The 300 HS is exactly what I was looking for. It's small, compact and ridiculously easy to use. I previously had the lower model which was really really bad in low light conditions and so wanted a camera that handles low light well. Again, this camera is absolutely superb in low light. When out in a club it takes lovely photos and always comes out really sharp and warm. I recently went to San Francisco and took a load of landscape shots. They are simply stunning little photos. This camera takes shots that look like they were taken from a professional SLR camera but at less than half the price. The 1080i HD is also flawless. Looks jaw-droppingly sharp and smooth.An absolutely stunning little camera and a real bargain too. I definitely recommend this for anyone looking for a small compact camera."
20120226"
column133:
Love it.  Easy to use. Great photos both up close and distant. Love the small size. Well worth the price."
20120226"
column136:
for valentines day my wife suggested we get something for us both. GREAT! we got the canon elph 300 powershot. we have a powershot sd780 (i think that is the model name/number). i went with the NOT touchscreen style: i like the buttons. it does the hd video. it otherwise seems the same. it is great. i had to get fatter cards = 16gb now instead of 4."
20120222"
column138: Great Features. Useless for children or pets!
column139:
I've been through plenty of cameras over the years and have had a very good history with Canon.  However, this camera was a huge disappointment.  The reviews were great and the technical specs and features are excellent.  The one thing I never saw before the purchase was how long it takes to acquire a focal point and actually snap the shutter.If you want to take photos of kids or pets, this is NOT the camera for you!  You will miss every cute moment you planned to capture when buying a pocket camera like this.I've tried adjusting countless settings and cannot seem to speed the button-to-shutter time enough to be useful.  My spouse keeps trying the camera because its small enough to cary (compared to the Rebel) but consistently threatens to throw it through the window.On the up side, the video quality is good.  I actually dialed back the quality a bit to get more time on our card and we're still very happy with the video.  Its too bad that's all we find useful on this camera."
20120222"
column142:
My family has been big in photography for as long as i can remember. MY mom owns a Canon EOS-1Ds Mark III and between her and i using it, we have filled up almost 50gigs of just pictures on my computer. The only problem is it is big and heavy, and we need a backpack just to carry it and its lenses around. That's exactly why i wanted just a simple point and shoot that i could take anywhere with me, so i went ahead and bought this camera, and here's what it's about.This camera does EXACTLY what i want it to do and what it should do. I didn't buy this camera for the purpose of the best shots possible, at a relatively low cost, and in a small camera that I can take anywhere with me. For the purpose of my review, I'll be relating the quality of this camera to what you payed for it, not to the Quality of the EOS-1Ds Mark III. That being said, i couldn't ask for more out of this. This camera has plenty of features, takes great pictures, especially at low light, takes good quality video, and is really fun to mess around with the high speed video mode. Although the high speed may not be the best quality, and requires a good amount of light, it is fun and interesting to use. Anyways, im not going to get into the technical stuff with this camera, but i will say that it has gone beyond my expectations. I didn't really research many cameras before i bought this one, i just went to a camera store and asked them to hook me up with a decent point and shoot, and this is what i got, and man can i say I am so happy that this was the camera that they gave me.To address some issues about this camera that other people had, the black paint is textured... SLIGHTLY. Its not bad and is never irritating to touch. At least for me, i like the feel of the paint. And as for the sound in the high speed video mode, you dont need sound. When was the  last time you saw an extremely slow motion recording with the sound? and if there was sound, there's some really high tech stuff that has to go into that.And for the only con that i can find about this camera... would be battery life?? its not that bad, but iv had other cameras that last longer. And the only other bad thing about this camera is that i just dont find myself taking my EOS-1Ds Mark III anywhere because this camera is so simple, and so great."
20120222"
column145:
I got this camera so that I wouldn't have to lug my Canon Powershot SX100 around.  I love the SX100 because it takes incredibly good pictures and video.  However, it is a big camera and I have to carry it in a camera bag around my shoulder.  I finally decided to get something that was small, inexpensive, and could take really good pictures and video.  The ELPH 300 was highly recommended by a camera buff who I worked with.  Another thing I really liked about the camera is that the battery lasts a long time.  I have only charged it once and have used it several times taking video and pictures.  My powershot SX100 eats the like out of the batteries rather quickly (though I do think something is awry with it and may need repairs--I dropped it once).  The Powershot ELPH 300 has a long battery life relatively speaking.I am glad that I purchased this camera.  It takes great pictures and videos.  It is small and I just stick it in my pocket.  It has simple controls too.  If you want a simple and inexpensive camera that takes very good pictures and good video then this is a sure thing."
20120221"
column148:
I recently purchase this camera to replace my Canon PowerShot SD600. I received the camera a week before leaving on a Caribbean Cruise vacation. On the trip I took over 800 photos in various lighting conditions and situations. Nearly all of the photos came out clear and focused. It is capable of taking clear images out a side window of a moving vehicle, in a dark cave and even when zoomed in 20x. I am very impressed with this camera so far! It has proven to be a fantastic replacement for my previous Canon camera."
20120220"
column150: One of the best Point and Shoot in my mind
column151:
I am not going to go into a lot of technical details but here are a few things i wanna share:-Pros:- Great quality pictures: even in low light (not at night but 'low light' specially when you dont want flash and pics are dark otherwise)- Excellent wide-angle lens: This means if you are on a beach this lens will capture a major part of ocean :) or you can even use it to capture redwoods- sturdy: have dropped it 2-3 times it still works awesomely (just saying)- lot of preset modes- excellent HD moviesCons:- the bottom is slightly curved so hard to balance for self-timer pics- wide-angle: as weird as it may sound but its true. coz remember for portraits either you would have to stand too close or zoom in (aka quality loss)Overall, i would totally recommend this to anyone thinking about point and shoot.Also, i would suggest buying a 16GB card even if it costs little more mainly to take as many pics as you can without worrying about space.Happy Clicking!"
20120220"
column153: Washed out pics - both auto & ISO200-400, Disappointed
column154:
Replaced my Sony DSC-W350 with this camera 1 month ago. All pictures taken are washed out. Tried multiple combinations with same results:1.Indoors vs Outdoors2.Auto vs specific ISOs3.Day vs NightGood things to be said are:1.Solid sturdy feel with its all metal construct2.Very fast startupBut this camera fails Canon's reputation and the pic quality is a deal breaker, so please avoid this camera, DO NOT do yourself a disservice by getting this camera.Going back to my DSC-W350(for now)and giving away this camera to a friend's young kid to play around with."
20120220"
column157:
I've only had this little camera for about two weeks.  The pictures in moderate light are a little grainy, but I suppose I'll have to play with it some more to get the feel for it.  In the meantime, it satisfies my need for a portable camera to augment my DSLR, which I don't always like to cart around."
20120218"
column160:
So small, a cigarette pack would make a good storage case for it. So solid feeling that the temptation to drive nails with it is not unreasonable.To anyone knowing which end of a camera points forward, the owner's manual is a bit of a waste. I took the camera out of its shipping box after 10PM and used it almost immediately.Using only light from the bedroom LCD TV and laptop screen, I took eight nearly perfect pictures and a short movie clip. I had intentionally turned off the camera's flash to see what I would get.Too bad this was my wife's birthday present. Maybe I can talk her into a trade for my 10 year old Minolta Dimage.Recomendations: Buy this camera with 16Gbyte of memory and a spare battery ($10) and you'll be set for almsot any occasion.Complaints: Wish the zoom could be operated manually or at least slower. Wonder if I missed something in not fully reading the owner's manual."
20120217"
column163:
I wanted a small lightweight camera that I could easily take with me, but I was concerned that the controls would be hard to maneuver.  This camera is easy to use.  The controls feel good in my hand.  I am impressed with the pictures taken in a large  classroom setting as they show details of the room yet still a clear picture of a person a long way off."
20120217"
column166:
I should have bought a Canon a longtime ago... I used to be a cheapskate and would buy garbage digital camera's that would destroy a once in a life time shot, But this camera IS WICKED!!! I swear it make a bad photographer look like a pro, the auto setting is the best I've seen... hands down. I fish alot and I have to hand over my camera to a moron to take my pictures... NOT A PROBLEM ANYMORE! love the fish-eye setting, mini setting, the panorama setting... I love em all.Well built, very compact, the texture on it is weird at first but its for the better (durable) and I don't like the wrist band on it so I switched to a Wii controller one that I've had good luck with in the past because my old Olympus one broke off and I almost lost that camera. And the flash should be on the other side because you get a shadow sometimes in the bottom right hand corner because its too close to the lens, also you would think it would have came with a real owners manual but the hints and tips on the camera are a better idea anyways. Other than those Small problems its the best camera for the money anywhere!Thanks Amazon for having a killer deal on it too! Loyal customer"
20120216"
column168: Great camera. Does what it says it would do!
column169:
I bought this camera to replace my Canon PowerShot SD400, which my husband now uses as his pocket camera. I have been pleasantly pleased with the way this camera performs in low light, though I am still sort of overwhelmed with all the options. I usually just leave it on manual, daytime. I don't like how large the screen is but I think it's just because I am so used to the size and the feel of the old camera....speaking of which, I *do* prefer the straight lines and boxiness of the older camera to the curved 'cuteness' of this new one."
20120215"
column172:
I wanted a camera that had more options then your average smartphone camera.  On a budget, this camera proved a great option.  Great low light view, fast on/off process, great clarity on the shots.  Video very well. Sound quality was loud and clear.  I would definitely recommend this device for the amateur looking to capture day."
20120213"
column175:
I've never bought a camera in my lifetime (62 years) where I couldn't take a picture taking the camera right out of the box.  NOT this one!  I have to wait 'til I get the memory card!!!!!!!!!!!  Can't tell anybody about picture quality 'cause there's no memory card!  This camera may very well be the greatest thing since sliced bread but w/no memory card it's just a paperweight.And the two 32GB memory cards are 'Shipping Soon' along with the matching case.What a crock!"
20120212"
column178:
This camera is really handy, I had to choose between an DSLR and I chose this, it is really small and thin perfect to carry around. Great picture 'too"
20120212"
column180: I get the lens error too
column181:
I got the red version of the 300HS during the Xmas 2011 season, via Amazon. I was pretty happy with it, the videos and pictures were good quality in good light, although luke warm in anything but perfect light.In February 2012, my 2 year old dropped it about 2 feet onto a carpet with the lens extended. There are no scuffs or marks.  Now it no longer takes pictures, and the lens won't retract. Whenever you turn it on, it says 'Lens error, will shut down automatically, restart camera.' Then shuts down.After some google work, I found that this is a common problem with this model.  Several people suggested fixes: removing and reinserting the battery, pulling the lens in each direction while restarting,  among others. None are working for me.I will see if this is covered by warranty, however I don't have high hopes. I understand my daughter dropped it (2 feet onto a carpet), but I am not impressed with the durability, so I make this post as a warning to shoppers that the durability is poor. I am echoing a complaint that has been voiced by a number of other owners of this model."
20120210"
column184:
Purchased as a gift for my father, he loved the camera. Great for the dad who wants to take a picture of everything quickly."
20120209"
column187:
Camera is small, convenient and very cute. Pics are sharp, high def, very easy to use. Instructions are clear and I was up an running in no time!  I havent really looked into all the capabilities since just the AUTO function is more than enough for my needs. Overall very happy (its been 4 days)."
20120209"
column190:
Coming from a family of professional photographers, I cannot get away with just using my camera phone to take our pictures.  I wanted something small and easy to use that had good color range and takes good pictures.  This camera is all of those things, obviously not top of the line but the price is indicative of that.  Takes great beach pictures and fits in the wifes purse or my front pocket very easily so it works well for us"
20120209"
column193:
I like this camera a lot. It is not a super deluxe DSLR but no one said it was. It takes very god point and shoot photos and has enough features you can be very creative if you care to. The only caution is....it does not ship with an SD card so don't expect to use it right out of the box unless you order some memory."
20120209"
column196:
I love this camera!  It takes such great pics and has alot of scene modes and fun things to play with on it.  Picture quality is great too!  My husband is a professional photographer and he thinks this takes good pictures too.  This camera is perfect for me to carry around and get snapshots of my kids.  For a compact camera, this is a great buy!"
20120207"
column199:
Only disappointment I have right now is I bought this camera for around 170....then a few days later it showed up as 130 something. ;-/ Kind of upset that i paid more when they changed the price that fast but whatever. The camera is so small and light weight im afraid its so fragile its gonna break. I love the camera though. The pictures show up crystal clear, all the different options for taking pictures packed into this tiny discreet camera are amazing."
20120206"
column201: Love it!  Can't go wrong with Canon!
column202:
I've owned the PowerShot since the G1 days, and i've gotten 3 or 4 cameras, all Canon, so this was an easy choice for me.  The pictures are vibrant and this little camera packs a punch!  Has all the functionality i need and the pics turn out great!  I had compared the pictures I took with a friend who had a Nikon and mine turned out much better.  Highly recommended!"
20120205"
column205:
I looked for a new camera after my old canon powershot s60 conked out and so far have been extremely satisfied with the Canon ELPH 300. I am not a serious photographer and wanted a point-and-click variety that I can use on trips and is easy to carry. The camera is VERY easy to carry and VERY easy to use. The battery holds a very decent charge (we didn't have to charge it on a 3 day trip that included video and photos).  The camera seems to have a huge host of features which I haven't fully tried out yet (though the long exposure is one I tried and enjoyed). Another great feature is that it captures video with zoom which is VERY handy. Unless I am doing some serious recording, I find it  extremely useful that I can snap pictures and capture some simple video right from my camera. There are several smartphones which are fast becoming  good cameras, but I still find that digital cameras are a cut above them and would highly recommend this to point-shoot amateurs who want decent shots with minimum fuss or baggage.After taking it on 4-5 trips I will say that I am quite satisfied with the camera quality in terms of shots in reasonable light as well as its video abilities (for a point-shoot class)."
20120204"
column208:
Pros:1. Clear image2. High resolution3. Slim and simple design4. Large LCD5. Battery cover is flimsyCons:1. Distorted/elongated the left & right edges of the photo (are all digital cameras like this nowadays? cuz my old Sony digital camera don't have this problem).2. Inaccurate battery warning, no percentage, but only 3 bars (the battery was fully charged and was used very little for 2-3 days. I left it in the camera, a few more days later, it still showed 'full' at 11am, then it died at around 3-4pm. I only less than 20 photos!)3. Battery dies fast!4. No day time in the display5. Auto mode behaves inconsistently. (The flash sometimes will only work in Auto-mode, I have to use the Manual mode to make sure it works.)6. Make photos vivid one at a time in the camera only. (I wonder why there's no option to take photos vividly or comes with a software to make all photos vivid in the computer.)7. Sometimes pressing the big buttons to take pictures don't work. (When I try to take self-shots, I pressed the big button and saw the lens blink, but photo is not captured.)8. The 'review' function is slow when it's off after every photo is taken. (When I tried to make quick shots at an event, I turned off the review function, but it still makes me wait 1 second to take a second photo.)I've never own anything better than this camera. I start to see its cons as I use it, but I still love this camera.Everyone was talking about getting the camera that's made in Japan. Mine's made in Japan. Hope it lasts long.Update 2/21/2012:Ricardo is right. I found that vivid photo setting.And the distorted edges are call 'barrel distortion.' The lens is built this way and there is no way to disable it. The distortion is fine when taking landscape pictures, but it really widen & fatten people on the sides when trying to take group pictures or when trying to take self-shots. :(Photos were not deleted from the flash memory card when I tried to do it in my computer. I've to either delete them or format the card from the camera if I need more space."
20120204"
column211:
I've owned/used many Canon's over the years both professionally and for personal use.  Canon knows what their doing. Going by the specs I don't dive too deep because I've never been unhappy with Canon.  I breeze past low-ball ratings because people can't figure it out or don't like a feature. I've found a few fundamental problems with this camera.The focus on the camera in general is great but the speed between you pressing the button and it shooting is way too long.  Low or high light.The flash takes literally 10 seconds before you can take another photo.  I understand this is a point and shoot, but thats insane.  I've used a lot of cameras and 10 seconds is way too long.  Tell a one year old to hold that pose.  Good luck.  You just missed it.The battery is weak.  I've taken great care to properly charge this battery and have cycled through it about 10x and it's gotten a bit better.  You'll need to buy a few more so you can use this camera like a normal one.  Shooting video kills it as expected but 15 minutes of 1080 will fully kill this battery.  15 Minutes.  I've played with the auto focus and the focus settings but it's still a battery killer.  I'm fully aware that video will kill these but seriously 15 minutes.  So take video out of the mix and you'll still get hopefully 50-75 photos.  Flash also throws a wrench into the battery of course so cut that number by 50%.  I have 3 batteries so this isn't a bad battery I got from Canon.It's a bad design or bad firmware because if this is how it's supposed to work this is my last Canon.  That said, when it works it looks really nice.  I'm even happy with the video.  Canon still has a chance to fix this camera with firmware and I sure hope they do.  The size is perfect but can we all agree it's thin enough?  Can we make some/any advance in battery life?  This camera went backwards.  I'd understand about the flash's refire rate or the slow focusing if the battery lasted longer.  It would make sense.  Seriously, make it thicker if you can't shoehorn a bigger battery in."
20120204"
column213: Canon ELPH 300HS or the Canon SX40HS? What are you using the camera for?
column214:
Someone recently asked whether they should get the SX40 for shooting pictures of the family, kids at play, and spur of the moment fun happenings. Since I have the SX40, and use it exclusively and almost always for nature photography, I don't usually like to give advice on what someone SHOULD buy. However, I also have the Canon PS Elph 300 HS and the older Canon PowerShot SD1100IS (Elph), and for parties and quick grab-and-shoot photography, I can whole-heartedly recommend the Elph 300 HS.My advice (and now I've been asked 7 times about a comparison of the two cameras):People aren't my forte. I much prefer bugs, bunnies, bees, bear, butterflies, and birds. For spur of the moment shots of family - from parties to candid shots of the kids (grandkids) - I prefer the ELPH 300 HS which also has 1080p HD Video. It's the kind of camera that you can just take with you or have in your pocket, and it's also small enough to have just lying around the house and to grab quickly.The SX40HS is also good for family activities, but I think it may be more camera than you need or would want. It weighs 24 ounces (including battery) and is just slightly less bulky than a DSLR. You can use it for high definition videos, but unlike the Elph, it's unwieldy and I suggest a tripod. I don't think a tripod is necessary for vids with the Elph: it's so light (5 ounces!), all you need is a relatively steady hand.If you are going to take videos, get an extra battery.IF you want to get into nature photography (see my noncommercial nature photo site), but don't want a DSLR, and if you're willing to go through the learning curve, then I might suggest the SX40. But we have two Elphs and for a quick grab and shoot, it's the one I'd recommend. Btw, it has a fantastic lens. The pix are sharp and all you have to learn is composition (which eludes some people).I can't make the decision for you, but from what you've described, the SX40 is just more camera than what you'll need and it might just lie around because it's too much trouble. The Elph has a lot of capability, but the great thing is that it will fit into any pocket and it will give you great pictures. And, btw, some of my landscapes and a few of my butterflies were taken with my wife's Elph. At times I actually prefer it for macros.And you'd be saving about $150.EW"
20120201"
column217:
I received this camera as a gift for Christmas even though I picked it out myself.  I spent days looking at different cameras on the internet and reading all of the different reviews and I just kept coming back to this one.  I did go to the stores and look at them after I had it narrowed down.  Everything I read about it is pretty much dead on, its a great point and shoot.  It is small, but I think I like that about it.  I am still able to easily operate the camera and it doesn't have take up much space in my  pocket.  It is very quick in startup and in between shots.  It takes excellent pictures and video.  Don't worry about all of the different reviews you read that try and point out flaws in the pictures, the picture quality is excellent (I am displaying on a brand new 27' MAC) and I really see no issues.  It does have a lot of cool features that are kind of buried in the menu system, but I don't think I have used anything except the auto mode to this point.  Also, I was able to get it on sale on here for $120.  So, if you need a digital camera that takes great pictures and video and you aren't looking to invest in an SLR camera, I highly recommend it."
20120131"
column220:
I received the Camera on Jan 31st unboxed it and as usual started taking pics. Surprisingly after 2 photos the Camera hung, I tried couple of times to switch it off but it did not, I thought for a moment I will have to ship it back but finally it turned off and I restarted and it started to work normal. After that I did not see any issues with the camera till now. Hope in long run it will not cause any issues.Apart from that the camera is good, I liked the size of it. It take pretty decent pictures."
20120131"
column223:
I am a huge fan of the Canon Powershot cameras and have owned and carried varying models around the world and back.That being said, this camera is smaller than any previous model I've owned and takes similar quality pictures. I find the photos from the 300HS are over-saturated and macro close-ups are very difficult to take. White balance is poor. Focus is different than my SD870IS so there's a bit of a learning curve to this 'new' processor.This is an Automatic Point and Shoot. Turn it on and take a snapshot.The settings menu is not as easy to navigate as previous Powershots and for space-saving they moved the Scenes from a dial to the menu which is a bit more effort to select night scene or pets or fireworks.. etc. There is a single switch to shift between fully AUTO and whatever you've set the scene, via the menu, to be.SUPER SLOW MOTION VIDEO is awesome!~ As are a few of the other scene options. The camera works great for the point and shoot and it's just the right size for my intended purpose. I need to have a camera with me at all times and this fits the bill.A screen protector on the LCD allows me to toss this in a bag or leave it lying in my vehicle console without worry. I'm on the fence about wether I would purchase this exact camera again, leaning toward no since I have grown accustomed to a Panasonic's impeccable focus (since my 870 died) and I definitely prefer the white balance of a Sony I have for Macro work - i.e., taking pics for eBay or product shots.Seems the 300HS is better suited for 'general' photography, like catching the sunset, taking pics of houses for work or catching your friends doing silly things. As with most of these little cameras, there is no telephoto and the 3-5x zoom doesn't do much at all.I vote middle of the road on this.. what was my favorite camera in the world and my 6th Canon Powershot.Update: I should have given this camera another star simply for the fact it can take pictures in incredibly low light without a flash. It is quite a remarkable little camera, but I still have issues with it. ...as my only camera which I carry with me and use nearly every single day."
20120130"
column225: Great Camera For An Amazing Price
column226:
got this thing with the intentions of finding an inexpensive way of recording HD videos. my hopes were low in the sense that for what i paid, i figured it was too good to be true. But after about a month of messing around with the settings i'd have to say this camera has done what i have expected plus more. great value for a camera that has such a great appeal"
20120130"
column229:
I really have been enjoying my new camera. It is so easy to use and the resulting photographs are clear and crisp.  I wanted a small camera that was small enough to slip into my pocket or purse and this one is easily transportable, ready to take pictures of landscapes and/or people.  I'm a very senior citizen and like to have products that are easy to use with good results without having to peruse pages of instructions.  This is the camera for me."
20120129"
column232:
The reviews on this site were helpful to me in choosing the Canon PowerShot Elph 300 to replace my old camera. So far, I'm very impressed. I use it a lot for business under not always ideal conditions. The picture and video quality even in low light is great. I ordered a couple of cheap replacement batteries so I always have a back up. It's tiny but powerful. I haven't explored all the bells and whistles yet but I didn't really need the manual to get started using it. The controls are pretty intuitive if you've had a digital camera before."
20120127"
column234: Excellent Point N' Shoot! ( Elph 300HS, Black)
column235:
I really can't say very many  more positive things about this amazing camera that have not been said already. It takes amazingly vivid and detailed pictures outdoors, low light, and even no light! Test it out in a completely darkened room, and you will be shocked at the resulting image. I purchased the black model, and I have to say that the people who describe the finish as being like sandpaper are exagerating a bit. Most big box stores carry this model now, so you can finger it yourself before you buy it there or here on Amazon. I think it adds a solid grip to this camera and makes it a little more rugged looking and feeling. As of this month,Jan. 2012, The Canon Elph 110HS is now out, with all the features of this Canon Elph 300HS and more, so on paper, The Elph 110 is a better camera, as it has Digic 5 sensors and this one has Digic 4, It is 16.1 Megpxl.s and this has 12.1 and unlike it's predesesor, The Elph 100, can zoom while in 1080p video. Oh, and it's $20 dollars cheaper! Amazon has it, but you will have to directly type it into the search. Bigger LCD screen, as well. I would also point you to Youtube, as there are many video reviews of The Elph 300HS and 310HS posted there. The 310HS is essentially very simmilar to The 300HS, but has a larger LCD, and 8X's zoom and The 300HS only has 5X's zoom but utillizes it well and does pretty good a little beyond optical zoom, but this time there is a $55 dollar increase with The 310HS. As I said, The Powershot Elph110 is a better camera on paper, but it is so new, there are not any reviews on it yet, so I would still stick with The 300 HS or 310 HS or even The SX230... if a little more size isn't an issue, because it has 14X's zoom and that's finaminal. My girlfriend has The SX230HS and it takes SLR quality shots, almost. Each 1x increment in zoom is a huge improvement in flexabillity and quality. More megapixles really dosn't mean much, most times. I hope I haven't overwhelmed you guys, but just stick with The Canon HS models and you won't go wrong! Update: Purchased some cool goodies last week for this camera. They include: The Case Logic TBC-302 case, The Pedco Ultrapod tripod, The Amazon Basic A to C Type HDMI Cable('Mini' to HDMI), and a $5.00 twin pack of spare batteries from Eforcity, and a 16gb Class 10 SD Card. I will review these items to, as I use them."
20120127"
column238:
I have a Canon A620 that seemed like it might be on its way to extinction.  I really liked the pictures it took, so I decided to get another Canon camera.  At first I thought I should get another camera that took AA batteries, but as I checked price/features/weight I decided to buy the HS300 from Amazon.  I think I did well price-wise because they were on sale and came with a 4GB SD card (one of the '10' series, which I think is faster than the '4' series), and cables.  Anyway, I took the new camera with me to Italy.  It performed very well and was very light weight.  Even with many hours of walking per day the weight and size were great - I never felt tired or had trouble shoving the camera into a pocket or purse.  Compared to the heavier weight A620 I did find there was more of a tendency for the camera to move as I pressed the shutter button, so more care was required to get clear pictures.  But the balance between price/features and weight was good for me.  I'm glad I bought it."
20120127"
column241:
This is a sweet little camera.  The main reason I bought it was to snap photos through a microscope.  I teach BIOL 1111 and 1112 in our community technical college and wanted to show my students the actual slides they would be using.  I insert them into a PowerPoint presentation.I bought a device to attach to the scope, which will hold the Canon 300.  However, I have been really pleased in that I can hold this camera at the eyepiece and take pictures by hand.  Right now the pix are still on the SD card, but I plan to post some later.I played around with the movie mode and am really happy with the quality of the video.  It would rival my little camcorder, only the Canon 300 doesn't have a viewfinder.Anyway, it is just what I wanted.Bobby"
20120127"
column244:
this camera hits the nail on the head when it comes to being portable.  good/simple point and shoot, poor night time/ low light photography, very few shooting option, build quality is good (as with most canon cameras. as for the toughness, not too sure since i've never dropped it.  gets cramped in the hand after awhile so use a wrist strap."
20120126"
column247:
This is the third powershot camera I bougnt from Amazon. It is very light and easy to keep in pocket. I love it."
20120125"
column249: Awesome camera ! easily carried and beautiful shots
column250:
showed my friend what i'd bought and he demanded one too.. we loved it and it's easy to use. the manual settings are better then the auto settings for low light but this is the best camera i've had in awhile and i prefer it to my super expensive Nikon DSL.. this little cam is one of the best purchases i've ever made and i'm planning on getting more for family members and friends.. it's great !! get one !! highly recommend"
20120125"
column253:
This camera was purchased for my wife, who is taking pictures frequently. Her previous Canon failed, thus purchasing this one. She is having a terrible time with 'fuzzy' pictures. The action button is held to allow focus to take place, but the resulting pictures don't show a sharp image. Flash, even when selected, doesn't always work either.Probably wouldn't but this product again. It was researched before purchase and seemed like a good camera for her.Here's a link to the camera. [...]"
20120123"
column256:
So my last canon crapped out, lenses got stuck open. I'd dropped it harshly many at time. Can't blame Canon for that really. So actually tried getting a shock proof camera from a competitor. It was bulky & the pics just didn't compare. Quickly bought got myself this guy & am happy I did. Super-compact & the pic quality can't be beat for the price point :)"
20120122"
column259:
My last camera drowned to death and I never thought I would find another one I could be so happy with.  This, however, is a camera I have a romance with.  Compared to some other cameras in its price range, it is really a looker! It's smaller than my cell phone and the red is radiant.For a camera so small, it works quite well in low-light situations, which is the primary reason I chose it.  Whereas with other cameras set on low-light and without flash, photos are a complete blur, on this camera photos can still come out reasonably well with only a slight blur.The movies turn out nicely too, however, if you zoom while recording, you may hear the zoom extending or retracting.Really though, for this price?  No complaints!"
20120122"
column262:
This a nice basic camera with a 5X zoom. I was looking for a replacement to an older ELPH I was using that belongs to a friend. I realized the higher zoom was what I really wanted. I didn't check all the spec before buying this camera. Yea, it has a greater zoom, but it lacks some of the other features from the other camera such as the ability to take black & white or sephia shots, color swap, etc. Although I rarely used those functions it would have been nice to have them."
20120122"
column264: perfect for the pocket size camera
column265:
My daughter in law want a small camera to put in her bag. She Has a larger DRL camera, but is not always carrying it with her for those unexpected opportunities . She uses the small one all the time. The pictures are great."
20120122"
column267: The perfect point and shoot camera for me
column268:
I have been wanting to replace my 5 year old Sony camera with a Canon since it seemed easier to use.  So after almost a year of reading reviews, I finally made the decision to buy this camera as a Christmas gift to myself.  I am glad that I bought this camera.It takes really good pictures on auto mode and is small enough to use with just one hand.  I lost the wrist strap but I'm not worried about dropping the camera.  The sandpaper-like texture of this camera provides just the right grip.Though it can shoot 12megapixel photos, I set it only at 2 megapixels since my photos are mostly for posting online.I love that the battery charger is compact, with no long cords."
20120121"
column270: Canon did a bad job on this one
column271:
I had two powershots and wanted to get a new one, so I tried this one.  There was sooo much noise if you zoomed into the image at all it was unacceptable.  Canon is going the wrong way making a camera like this.  I want the image quality to be good before adding other features."
20120120"
column274:
I bought this for my wife since she always has problems taking in focus pictures with her old camera.  She loves this new one.  All of the pictures she took at Christmas came out great.  I'm sure she won't use many of the features that this camera has but as long as she is happy that's great."
20120120"
column277:
I love this camera! It takes great shots; they are clear and vivid. There are so many extra features that are fun and easy to use."
20120119"
column279: Great pictures, poor craftsmanship, worse customer service
column280:
I purchased a Canon ELPH 300 HS less than a year ago. Loved the still pictures and videos it took. After three months of ownership, the front lens cover got dented because I placed this 'pocket' camera in my, you guessed it, pocket. Unfortunately the keys that cohabited this front pocket dented the flimsy lens cover. No matter, a cosmetic flaw. Three months later, however, the lens would not extend and the camera would immediately switch off (dreaded 'Lens Error'). From a variety of news postings, it seems that this is not an uncommon problem in the ELPH because sand or dirt (you know, things that might end up in small amounts in your pocket) can get into the zoom assembly and cause it to jam. I sent in the camera, paperwork, and warranty to Canon. Canon then sent an email informing me that (1) they don't fix this camera, ever and (2) because of the unrelated damage, they won't offer a replacement (they would be happy to replace it with a refurbished unit for full price!). I then called the service number and spoke with two incredibly unknowledgeable and unhelpful customer 'service' representatives who read to me from a script and who continued to refuse to honor the warranty. I cannot recommend strongly enough against buying this camera - you are buying something that is poorly made from a company that has no intention of honoring their warranty."
20120118"
column282: No complaints, perfect point and shoot
column283:
I am by no means an expert with cameras (I don't even the make the cut as an average fauxpert), so I feel I should be extremely easy to please when it comes to a simple and effective camera to be used for the most straightforward uses possible--photos for tourism, for drunken nights with friends, capturing moments of everyday hilarity, or even just my goldfish. It doesn't seem much to ask at all--yet, why have I been let down by digital cameras time and time again for the past six years?!Well, I am now finally glad to report that I have found a reliable camera that is consistently good for this average point and shoot user. Note the key terms 'reliable' and 'consistent'--these descriptive words have a conspicuous absence from my experiences with past cameras. So. Hallelujah! Thank you, Canon, for enabling a simpleton like myself to capture striking images of my goldfish (Woodward and Bernstein)."
20120118"
column286:
I bought this one ($150 at Fred Meyer) after returning a Nikon S9100 (which was horrendously disappointing).  The gal at the counter suggested the Canon, she was preferential as that was a brand she used routinely.  She was great enough to demo the model on display, and it has amazing capabilities.  The traditional zoom is wonderful (see the pictures I've included of the living room versus the read door), and the macro zoom is impressive as well (see all the other pictures I posted).  I'm not a professional photographer, I was just looking for something to replace my older, bulky digital camera, and this thing is a joy to use.  It's slim when not in use, and takes exactly the type of pictures I want.  The video feature is nice, easy to use, though the microphone on it isn't great.  Keep that in mind; if you're planning on taking lots of video, it's heard to hear people if they're speaking in a normal voice when they're more than 4 feet away.  It isn't a problem for me, as that wasn't my primary purpose, but I can see the advantages in having it as a feature.  Might look into whether there is an exterior microphone option if we use it more in the future.  Take a look at the sample photos.  Again, I'm not a pro., and those were taken right after taking the camera out of the box, no instructions/manual used.  I highly recommend this camera- seems to be a great value."
20120118"
column289:
This is a great little camera. My wife has been looking for a quality camera that was small enough to go everywhere without a big bag. I gave her this for Christmas and it has so far delivered beyond expectations."
20120116"
column291: Poor image quality and photos can't be dragged and dropped to PC
column292:
I got the Elph 300 HS as a gift.  I had just bought a different brand of compact P&S, but returned it after I saw all the great ratings and reviews for the Elph 300HS from professional reviewers and customers. After having the Elph 300 HS camera for a month I am really surprised that so many reviews are positive, which have fooled me and others into going with this mediocre camera.  Yes, it looks nice and is small, but the image quality is very disappointing and there is no way to directly drag and drop the photos from the camera onto your computer.Image quality - This camera is touted as being good in low light due to Canon's update to better sensor technology in this model.  Far from being better in low light, it is much worse than my previous compact point and shoot.  Indoor images are blurred when anyone in them makes even the slightest of motion during the shot.  And they are not just a little blurred; they are significantly blurred even when the lighting in the room is good.  I also have experienced an excessive yellowness to images taken without the flash indoors.  With most cameras there is usually a nice warmness to photos taken indoors without flash, but the Elph 300 HS goes way beyond a nice warmness to excessive yellowing.Downloading photos - I am surprised that I read nothing about the lack of direct download capability in all my research on this camera.  I went on a weekend trip and afterward went to download my photos to my Mac like usual with all my prior cameras.  I have always dragged and dropped the photos onto my hard drive into folders, and only import them into software programs when I want to edit them.  When I connected the camera to several different computers, none of them show the camera as an external drive.  As a result, this camera does not allow dragging and dropping; you must use a software program just to get the photos to your computer.  You have to install and use the software from Canon's CD, or use iTunes or iPhoto or similar to get the photos from the camera to a computer.  This is a hassle and a waste of time.  After then searching specifically for this problem online, I found that some others have experienced the same issue and it appears to be the camera design and not a unique problem with my camera or computer.  Why doesn't Canon allow drag and drop?  I wonder if Canon could not get the camera to be so conveniently small if it had included whatever was needed to allow drag and drop, and thus it traded a capability that ever other digital camera I've had came with in order to try to appear so attractively small to buyers.  I never imagined I wouldn't be able to just drag and drop the photos because I've never known anyone who couldn't from their digital camera.With these major flaws already apparent after only a few weeks of use, I would not recommend the Elph 300 HS."
20120116"
column295:
I bought the camera new about 10 months ago (in 2011)...This is the best ultar-compact digital camera I have owned, and it has met all my expectations.- Ultra compact- Great picture quality- Easy connection to PC and TV (includes HDMI connection)- Takes great video- My favorit feature is the 'Burst' mode with rapid shots"
20120116"
column297: Great Camera for a Great Price
column298:
Have only had this camera for a couple of weeks but it has not let me down at all.I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for an inexpensive digital camera you can take with you anywhere you go. Enjoy it, I know I am."
20120114"
column301:
This camera is great.  Clear photos and it is easy to operate. Love the closed eye detection feature.Would definitely buy again."
20120114"
column304:
The camera I received was defective. When I turn it on, the screen comes on but it takes a full minute for any of the buttons to work and be ready to take a picture. This is the second Canon Ive purchased in the last 6 weeks that had this issue (the first I bought was a S95). All of my online searches indicate this is a precursor to the dreaded 'Lens Error'. Based on all the great reviews, I thought this one would be different. I was wrong."
20120114"
column307:
This camera is very small and great for when you're on the go and don't want to lug around a big DSLR. Sometimes I feel it can be a bit difficult to hold the camera because of its size and texture but it definitely fulfills the purpose of portability and quality that I was searching for. I was also very impressed with the variety of settings this little camera holds.Overall I would definitely recommend this product to those looking for a decent portable camera."
20120113"
column310:
I got what I ordered. It came more quickly than I expected. Make sure you understand that for some of these camera's you need to also order or have a memory chip. Because I had serious surgery immediately before Christmas, we have not been able to go out and buy the chip, so I really can't comment on the quality of the camera itself, but it had many good reviews online."
20120113"
column313:
The Canon elph 300 is the perfect point-and-shoot camera.Small, easily fits in shirt pocket or creates no uncomfortable bulge in a pants pocket.Quality is better than more expensive cameras.  Accepts old & new memory disks.Reviews state the 300 is a better camera than the replacement versions of the 300."
20120112"
column316:
Loved the pics, but LENS ERROR after two months!!!  Ugh, spent a good amount of money on this camera, but it's the second time a Canon camera has had this lens error problem.  Frustrating."
20120603"
column319:
sadly i did not purchase this camera from amazon, but from best buy, as I scored a great deal.  be that as it may, this camera does not perform any better than my canon a630 which is ~5 years old.  I got the black version which has a rough textured feel, which i kind of like. zoom is loud and camera is always constantly re-focusing.  several times the camera would just 'freeze' with the screen black and with the green light above the play button stuck on.  Luckily i just turned the camera off and it came back on.  this does not bode well and leads me to believe that this camera will not last very long.  some of the reviews mentioned the japan model being better. unfortunately i got the made in china model...Overall i would say i was just 'satisfied' with this camera and it serves its purpose as a basic p&s."
20120602"
column322:
Love the size of this camera. Not thrilled about the quality. Seems like the plastic battery/memory card slot cover could snap off easily. Not a whole lot of options on this thing, but it seems to take decent pics. Movie quality is okay. Overall, I'm underwelmed."
20120601"
column325:
This camera is awesome, especially for the price I got it for ($110 including shipping, not from Amazon), but even for a buck-fifty, it'd be worth it.It's fantastically small; the first camera I feel OK about putting into my pocket with my phone, as long as the camera has some protection.  The thing is a camera, not a phone - it's not designed to take as much abuse - if you carry it with no covering, you do so at your own self-inflicted peril.  It's not Canon's fault so many people don't know that dropping a camera on the ground can break it.  I thought that was pretty common knowledge since the 19th century.The look and feel is awesome.
